i agree this test should be safe to promote.

comments.body: this test appears to test the same functionality as the prior test since its using the same sysctl "kernel.shm_rmid_forced", is this an oversight?

`kernel.shm_rmid_forced` is in the safe set.

The current two test cases code are totally the same for `Sysctl, test sysctls` and `Sysctl, allow specified unsafe sysctls`. ðŸ˜“
This makes me question whether this test should be promoted then. No loss of coverage if we don't promote this?
Holding approval until I see an answer here

comments.body: It just documents that the test was first introduced to conformance in 1.17 but that there was a change in behavior in 1.21

comments.body: @johnbelamaric this is why we need your /approve for a PR that's just adding a new non-conformance test, @oomichi caught that we shouldn't have added a conformance test to the test/e2e/framework directory (ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/91230#discussion_r430713176) so it's been moved to the correct file
oops. ok. has it been running from there though? I mean, do we have soak time for this?
i.e., it is added as a conformance test below. so I want to make sure it was actually running at some point as a non-conformance test. i can check the board
